intro: Pavonia hastata f. euconsobrina, commonly known as the showy pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or purple bract-like flowers that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The botanical features of this species make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability.
